title: 'Joker' is a box-office beast: No. 1 again and a half-billion worldwide
text:
CLOSE The first teaser trailer for Joaquin Phoenix's "Joker" has been released. The movie hits theaters this October. USA TODAY

LOS ANGELES — "Joker" kept winning at the box office.

The R-rated comic-book villain origin story had a phenomenal second weekend at the box office, topping the charts once more over newcomers like the animated "The Addams Family" and the Will Smith action pic "Gemini Man."

Studios on Sunday estimate that "Joker" added $55 million from North American theaters, down only 43% from its record-breaking debut. Worldwide, the movie has earned $543.9 million to date.

"The Addams Family" exceeded expectations and took second place in its first weekend in theaters with $30.3 million.

"Gemini Man" stumbled out of the gates. The Ang Lee film starring Smith as an assassin on the run from a younger version of himself opened in third place with $20.5 million. It cost a reported $140 million to make.

Arthur Fleck (Joaquin Phoenix) moves to the music in his head in "Joker." (Photo: NIKO TAVERNISE)

"Abominable" and "Downton Abbey" rounded out the top five.

Final numbers are expected Monday.

Contributing: Kim Willis, USA TODAY
